intro: Hieracium subochroglossum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is a perennial plant that spreads through rhizomes and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
